historical_info: Started operations in the 1990s, connecting northern districts to the capital.
Kurigram Express connects Dhaka to the far north district of Kurigram.
One of the oldest and most reliable intercity trains on the Dhaka–Rajshahi route.
Lalmoni Express connects Dhaka with the northern district of Lalmonirhat.
Padma Express is a popular night service connecting Rajshahi with Dhaka.
A major intercity service connecting Rajshahi and Dhaka by day.
A popular overnight train serving northern districts like Thakurgaon and Panchagarh.
One of the oldest and busiest trains in the north-western region.
Provides daily long-haul service to Rangpur.
Popular among tourists traveling to Sylhet.
A regular intercity option between Sylhet and Dhaka.
Introduced to improve connectivity from Dhaka to the coastal town of Noakhali.
Named after the Tista River, serving suburban commuters.
A swift overnight service to the northern region.
Named after the Dolly Chapa flower, serving the Santahar–Dinajpur route.
A non‑stop service linking Dhaka and Rajshahi.
Known for connecting two major tourist hubs overnight.
Named for its swift service, linking Dhaka with northeastern towns.
Introduced to cater rising tourist traffic to Sylhet.
One of the oldest mail express services between Chattogram and Dhaka.
The oldest mail train service linking the port city with the capital.
Long-running daytime express connecting Dhaka and Chattogram.
Serves northern areas with increasing demand for rural access.
Provides vital connectivity for central-northeast regions.
Popular commuter train to Kishoreganj town.
Introduced in 2016 as a luxury service with minimal stops between Dhaka and Chattogram.
Connects major cities within Rajshahi Division to support local commuters.
Launched in 2019 to enhance direct communication between Rangpur region and the capital.
Provides direct, non-stop intercity service from Dhaka to Panchagarh, the northernmost district.
Launched in 2023 as the newest India‑Bangladesh link, named after the border‑spanning friendship mascot.
Introduced in 2010 as a fast daylight service linking the two major cities.
Mohanagar Provati and Godhuli form the oldest premium pair on the Dhaka–Chattogram route.

Turna Express was inaugurated in 1998 as a premium overnight Intercity train between Dhaka and Chattogram. It remains one of the most used services on this route, offering overnight convenience with modern amenities.
Bijoy Express was launched in 2004 to connect the eastern port city of Chattogram with the educational and administrative hub of Mymensingh. It is widely used by students and long-distance commuters.
Jamuna Express began operations in 1999, serving daily commuters and travelers between Dhaka and the northern districts across the Jamuna Bridge corridor.
Lalmoni Express began operation in 2004 to ensure direct overnight service from the northern Rangpur region to the capital Dhaka.
Karnafuli Express is one of the oldest mail trains between Chattogram and Dhaka, serving rural commuters for decades.
Silk City Express began operations in the early 2000s to connect Dhaka with Rajshahi, famous for silk and mangoes.
Padma Express launched in 2005 as an overnight alternative to Silk City Express on the Dhaka–Rajshahi route.
Sundarban Express began operations in the late 1990s, serving one of the longest Intercity routes between Dhaka and Khulna.
Chitra Express launched alongside Sundarban Express in the late 1990s, offering overnight service on the Dhaka–Khulna route.
Sagordari Express has been serving the Khulna–Rajshahi route since the early 2000s, named after the famous poem 'Sagordari' by Michael Madhusudan Dutt.
Dhumketu Express was launched in 2005 to offer early morning and overnight service between Dhaka and Rajshahi.
Tungipara Express was inaugurated in 2020 to honor the birthplace of Bangabandhu Sheikh Mujibur Rahman and improve connectivity to Gopalganj.
Sundarban Express began operations in the late 1990s, serving one of the longest Intercity routes between Dhaka and Khulna.
